name: CRYPTO WORD LADDER
description: If you're into crypto currencies you'll get this one right away, if not it'll look like a bunch 4 letter fake words. These are all contemporary (at the time of writing this) crypto currencies, with the exception of the last one HODL; I'll explain that one in a minute. DOGE/HOGE/HOGL are all independent of each other and yet are connected through the weird and wonderful world of word ladders. Being a crypto investor and an NFT artist blends together sometimes into a risky milkshake of peril and potential. (That's great Andrew, but what the heck is HODL then?) Great question reader! The word HODL started out as a misspelling of HOLD in reference to when Bitcoin was dropping fast back in 2018. It became a huge hit as a punchline. For awhile, everything was HODL this and HODL that. HODL memes were made. Clothing had the misspelling on it. It was the crypto zeitgeist for a time. The meaning has since been morphed as a acronym "Hold on for dear life”, which if you ask me sounds ok, but they conveniently leave off the "F" in the acronym; seems forced. Then again...some of the people reading this book will think half of what I do is forced...and they wouldn't be wrong per se. But I digress...
